properties.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 18 at 3:39AM CST until January 19 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Bismarck ND
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing and significant
drifting snow with low visibilities. Winds gusting as high as
40 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills
expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero.

* WHERE...Grant and Sioux counties.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until noon CST /11 AM
MST/ today. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from noon CST /11 AM
MST/ today to noon CST /11 AM MST/ Sunday.

* IMPACTS...Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce
visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills will cause
frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST /11 AM MST/ TODAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON CST /11 AM MST/ TODAY TO NOON CST /11 AM MST/ SUNDAY
